description:
Verify that a user can successfully add a new task by entering a task name, description, choosing up to 3 categories, selecting an emoji, and picking a custom color.

Click the "Add New Task" button/icon on the dashboard.
In the "Add New Task" modal, enter a value in the "Task Name" field (e.g., "Complete Project Report").
Optionally, enter a description in the "Task Description" field (e.g., "Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting").
Enter Task Deadline for example add today date.
Below "Select Categories (max 3)," choose any combination of up to three categories (e.g., "Work" and "Coding").
In the "Color" section, select any color (e.g., Electric Violet - #B624FF).
Click the emoji icon near the top to open the emoji picker.
Select an emoji to represent your task (e.g., üìù or üòÉ).
Click "Create Task" to submit.
Observe the application feedback (e.g., success message or new task appears in the task list).

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173
Click the Add New Task button or icon on the dashboard
Wait for the Add New Task modal to appear
Enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field
Enter 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field
Enter today's date in the Task Deadline field
Select up to 3 categories in the Select Categories section, for example choose 'Work' and 'Coding'
Select a color from the Color section, such as Electric Violet (#B624FF)
Click the emoji icon near the top to open the emoji picker
Select an emoji, for example üìù or üòÉ, to represent the task
Click Create Task to submit the new task
Observe the success message or confirm the new task appears in the task list
Take a screenshot of the completed task creation as evidence of successful operation

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add new task with modal inputs and validations

description:
Verify that a user can successfully add a new task by entering a task name, description, choosing up to 3 categories, selecting an emoji, and picking a custom color.

Click the "Add New Task" button/icon on the dashboard.
In the "Add New Task" modal, enter a value in the "Task Name" field (e.g., "Complete Project Report").
Optionally, enter a description in the "Task Description" field (e.g., "Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting").
Enter Task Deadline for example add any date.
Below "Select Categories (max 1)," choose any combination of up to one category (e.g., "Work" ).
Click "Create Task" to submit.
Observe the application feedback (e.g., success message or new task appears in the task list).

Open the app and ensure at least one active task is visible in the task list.
Locate the checkbox or tick icon next to an active task (e.g., "Project Deal").
Click the checkbox/tick icon to mark the task as done.
Observe that the task status updates visually (e.g., background changes, text strikethrough, checkmark appears).
Confirm that a notification appears stating all tasks have been completed (if it was the last open task).
Verify that the completed task now reflects its "done" status and is no longer considered active.

steps.stepDescription: Open the application by navigating to http://localhost:5173/
On the dashboard, locate and click the Add Task button or icon to open the task creation modal
In the Add New Task modal, enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field
Optionally, provide 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field
Enter a Task Deadline by selecting an appropriate date from the available date picker
Below the category selection area, choose a category (for example, 'Work') from the available options
Select an emoji from the emoji picker to represent the task
Pick a custom color from the color picker to assign a unique color to the task
Click the Create Task button to submit your new task
Observe the application feedback to confirm that a success message appears or the new task is listed in the task list
Verify there is at least one active task displayed in the task list on the dashboard
Locate the checkbox or tick icon next to an active task (such as a task labeled 'Project Deal')
Click the checkbox or tick icon to mark the chosen task as completed
Observe that the task's visual appearance updates, such as a background change, strikethrough text, or a visible checkmark indicating completion
If this is the last active task, check that a notification appears indicating that all tasks have been completed
Confirm that the completed task now shows a 'done' status and is no longer listed among active tasks
Take a screenshot of the final state to verify that the test has been completed successfully

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add and complete a task via modal

description:
Click the "Add Task" button/icon on the dashboard.
In the "Add New Task" modal, enter a value in the "Task Name" field (e.g., "Complete Project Report").
Optionally, enter a description in the "Task Description" field (e.g., "Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting").
Enter Task Deadline for example add any date.
Below "Select Categories (max 1)," choose any combination of up to one category (e.g., "Work" ).
Click "Create Task" to submit.
Observe the application feedback (e.g., success message or new task appears in the task list).

Validate that a user can revert a completed task to "not done" status and ensure the UI and task state update correctly.

Ensure at least one task is already marked as done (checkmark visible, strikethrough on text).
Click the three-dot menu ("...") on the completed task card.
Select "Mark as not done" from the dropdown menu.
Observe that the checkmark disappears, text formatting returns to normal (no strikethrough), and the task is now shown as active.
Verify notifications or success messages if any are displayed, confirming the status change.

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173/
On the dashboard, click the Add Task button or icon to open the Add New Task modal.
In the modal, enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field.
Optionally, enter 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field.
Enter a valid date in the Task Deadline field.
Select a category under 'Select Categories (max 1)' by choosing 'Work'.
Click the Create Task button to submit the new task.
Verify that the new task appears in the task list with a success notification or feedback message.
Ensure that at least one task is marked as done by checking that a checkmark is visible and the text shows a strikethrough effect.
Click the three-dot menu on the completed task card to reveal more options.
Select Mark as not done from the dropdown options to revert the task status.
Observe the UI to confirm that the checkmark disappears and the text formatting returns to normal, indicating the task is now active.
Verify any notifications or success messages confirming the status change are displayed.
Take a screenshot of the completed task list to document the final state.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add a task and revert its completion status

Verify that a user can change the position of a task within the task list using the move feature.

Open the task list and identify a task you want to move.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") for that task.
Select "Move" to activate move mode.
Drag and drop the task to a new position in the list.
Click "Done" or confirm the move if prompted.
Ensure the task now appears in the new position in the list.

steps.stepDescription: Open the web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173/
On the dashboard, click the 'Add Task' button or icon to open the task creation modal.
In the 'Add New Task' modal, ensure the modal is visible before proceeding.
Enter 'Complete Project Report' in the Task Name field.
Optionally, enter 'Summarize this quarter's achievements for the management meeting' in the Task Description field.
Enter a valid date into the Task Deadline field.
From the 'Select Categories (max 1)' option, choose the category 'Work'.
Click the 'Create Task' button to submit the new task.
Observe the application feedback, such as a success message or the appearance of the new task in the task list.
Open the task list and locate the task 'Complete Project Report' that was just added.
Click the three-dot menu ('...') associated with the selected task to reveal more options.
Select the 'Move' option from the menu to activate the move mode for the task.
Drag the task to the desired new position within the task list.
Click 'Done' or confirm the move if prompted to finalize the repositioning of the task.
Verify that the task now appears in the new position within the list.
Take a screenshot of the completed task list to confirm the successful move operation.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Add new task and reposition it
